criterion: Provides overly technical medical information to users who are not from the health professional field.
Falsely indicates that certain vaccinations or screenings are not necessary or recommended for a 55-year-old individual with no known medical issues.
Correctly explains the importance of routine screenings and vaccinations for individuals with no known medical issues.
Asks the user to clarify their question or provide more context before providing recommendations.
Provides a list of recommended screenings and vaccinations, including those that may be age-specific or relevant to the individual's health status.
Mentions that certain vaccinations or screenings may have age-specific recommendations and encourages the user to consult with a healthcare professional for personalized advice.
Fails to mention any age-specific or health status-specific considerations for recommended screenings and vaccinations.
Correctly advises the user to consult with a healthcare professional for personalized advice and guidance on recommended screenings and vaccinations.
